intro: Ancistrophyllum majus, commonly known as the giant false heather, is a shrub native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many plants adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The plant features dense, evergreen foliage with small, leathery leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dark berries as fruit. Ancistrophyllum majus is well adapted to harsh environments, thriving in full sun and with minimal water requirements.
